CHRIS CUOMO, CNN ANCHOR: To our viewers in the United States and around the world, you are watching “New Day.” Republican presidential frontrunner Donald Trump is facing heavy criticism after calling for a, quote, “total and complete ban on Muslims entering the United States.”

Mr. Trump joins us now on the phone.

Now, if you look at FDR – ’cause I watched Jeffrey Lord this morning and I thought he was fantastic, by the way, — If you look at him, the presidential proclamations, 2525, 2526, and 2527, it was very — that was very, very stringent.

You have leaders from your own party in the key states of Iowa, New Hampshire, South Carolina, you have galvanized political rivals, all saying this is un-American and extreme and that it makes you a fascist.
Now you have the problem in California where — and miraculously $28,000 just found, just put into this guy’s account, this horrible person, this killer, this maniac, into his account.
The fact is until our people can do something about these horrible people that want to do damage to our country, real damage to our country, then I think it stays in place.
Then the other day we had the California attack where these two animals, they’re total animals, they became radicalized and they wanted to do far more damage than that.
TRUMP: 25 percent of the Muslims living in the United States agreed that violence against Americans here in the United States is justified as part of the global jihad.
Tuesday on CNN’s “New Day,” host Chris Cuomo interviewed Donald Trump about his call to ban all Muslims from coming into the Untied States, which got very heated.
The police are all over that country right now and they’re doing a lot of policing, but more importantly to your point, I would say it’s the opposite reality.
You see the French being more embracing of people around them, you see them living their lives, you see them refusing to accept fear as a basis for behavior.

TRUMP: Chris, we can be nice — We can be politically correct, but we have a problem in this country —

TRUMP: Look — I’m talking about a temporary situation until our country’s representatives can figure out what the hell is going on, Chris.
